712129f-a.text:
East 34th Street, west from Third Avenue, as photographed from the Third Avenue 'E1" atation. At the left is the 34th Street Theatre, a motion picture house. Above same towers the 7lst Regiment Armory and the Vanderbilt Hotel. Note the absence of the Empire State Building. In thw center is the Cameron Bldg. outlined against the mcrble B. Altmen & Co. store. To the right are the two Park Avenue apartments at 35th Street. The castleatted tower above, is atop the Combustion Engineering Bldg.
1: About 192S
2: Jan. 19, 1937
P. L. Sperr
W:. P. A., photo
Five Boroughs Project

712127f-a.text:
E. 34th Street, north side, east from Third Avenue, showing mainly the frontage between the Second and Third Avenue "El" lines. In the center is U. S. Post Office Station "F', the site of which is proposed as the entrance to the Midtown GQueens TTunnel under the East River. The several high stooped houses (No's 215-219) adjoining
same on the west, were demolished in May-June 1939.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel authority

712128f-a.text:
E. 34th Street, south side, east of Third Avenue,to the East River, showing structures that will face the entrance te the 38th Street tunnel under the East River. The New York Times of Jan. 23, 1938 reported the proposed construction of a 9 story glass brick apartment house on the sites of No's 222-228. These appear adjoining the last larger building and are in the center
of the block.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New Iork City Tunnel Authority

712130f-a.text:
East 34th Street, west across Third Avenue, showing prominently the Third Avenue "E1' station. This is of special construction and provided for its own trains, an overpass, and the former spur unit. In the background appears the vague outline of the Empire State Bldg.
May 27, 1939
P. L. Sperr

708039f-a.text:
Third Avenue, east side, north from E. 34th Street. At the right is the N. W. corner of this point and the stairway leading to the Third Avenue Elevated station overhead.
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

708041f-a.text:
Third Avenue, west side, north from E. 34th to 35th Streets.
January 7, 1939
Samach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

708044f-a.text:
Third Avenue, west side, south from E. 35th Street, showing mainly the 35th-34th Street frontage. At the right is an old frame building long standiig at this corner. At 34th Street appears a station of the Third Avenue "El."
January 7, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

708046f-a.text:
Third Avenue, east side, south from E. 35th Street, showing mainly the 35th-34th Street frontage.
